page.title: 05GOOD COMPANIONS CLUB cont
page.content: ncreased to 15p to off-set the rise for the hire of the Hall and the raffle tickets would be 10p each. A competition was held for the best dressed egg, won by Mr. & Mrs. Mckay. On 16th April, 1985 the club celebrated its 11th birthday, various games were played, members provided photgraphs of themselves when children. Some amusing photos were displayed. Mrs. Munday guessed the highest no. recognising 7. A splendid tea was provided with sherry and birthday cake being enjoyed by all. On 14th May, 1985 members attended, in Framlingham, the annual service for 'Age Concern' (national organisation). On 18th June, 1985 members enjoyed a coach trip which included lunch at Kings Lynn, and a visit to the Violet Centre and the Wedgewood Glass Works, seing various methods of manufacture of glass dishes and ornaments.
